fields.shortName: Does the company have a Corporation Tax Unique Taxpayer Reference
fields.helpText: The company will have a Unique Taxpayer Reference if it has previously registered for UK Corporation Tax. For example, if it has traded as a property developer or has had a permanent UK establishment in the past.

sections.title: What is the Corporation Tax Unique Taxpayer Reference?

fields.label: What is the Corporation Tax Unique Taxpayer Reference?
fields.helpText: This is 10 numbers, for example 1234567890. It will be on tax returns and other letters about Corporation Tax. It may be called ‘reference’, ‘UTR’ or ‘official use’.

fields.shortName: Does the company have an Income Tax Self Assessment Unique Taxpayer Reference
fields.helpText: Your company will have an Income Tax Unique Taxpayer Reference if it has received or currently receives rental income in the UK as a non-resident landlord. This is 10 numbers, for example 1234567890.

fields.label: What is the company's Income Tax Self Assessment Unique Taxpayer Reference?
fields.shortName: Income Tax Self Assessment Unique Taxpayer Reference
fields.helpText: This is 10 numbers, for example 1234567890. This is on SA700 tax returns or other correspondence from HMRC about the company's rental income.

sections.title: When did the company dispose of the property, land or interests in entities holding UK land?

fields.helpText: A disposal means a sale, gift or transfer of ownership. This is the date legal ownership is transferred. For example, 06 04 2019
fields.errorMessage: The date of disposal cannot be before 06 04 2019 or after today

declarationSection.title: Make your declaration and send the form

fields.label: Declaration copy
fields.infoText: By submitting this form you declare that the information that you have provided is true and complete.
This is your last opportunity to print or save a PDF copy of your submitted registration.
##If you are registering for Corporation Tax for the first time

We will use the information you have provided to set up a record for the company and send you a Corporation Tax Unique Taxpayer Reference. We will also send you more information about what you need to do next.
You will only be able to register for HMRC online services and file your return once you have received your Unique Taxpayer Reference.
##If you are re-registering for Corporation Tax
If you are re-registering for Corporation Tax we will use the information provided to update our records. You will then be able to use HMRC online services to file returns and make payments.
